intro: Kalidiopsis, commonly known as the Cape rose or mountain daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to South Africa. These plants are part of the Asteraceae family, characterized by their composite flower heads and showy blooms. Kalidiopsis species typically grow in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. They produce small, delicate flowers in shades of yellow, pink, and white, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. The genus includes several species, each adapted to specific ecological niches within its native habitat.
